name: SecureDrop ID - Delivery Authorization System
description: A Proof-of-Concept (PoC) system designed to enhance last-mile delivery security through double verification mechanisms. SecureDrop introduces a customer-first authorization model using QR codes, OTP, and (future) NFC-based validation, empowering customers to control package handovers while enabling brands to reduce fraud and unauthorized deliveries.
features: Unique SecureDropID with QR tagging for each package
Customer-controlled delivery approval via B2C app
Double verification for delivery agents (QR + OTP/QR/NFC)
B2B SDK for seamless integration with brand backends
Delegated authorization via dynamic codes for family/friends
Delivery audit trail with verification history

B2B_SDK: SecureDropID + QR tagging for every order
Integration APIs for brand backend systems
Verification hooks for real-time authorization checks
Lightweight QR service for package tagging
B2C_App: Delivery dashboard to track and manage upcoming orders
Approve or reject deliveries in real-time
Multi-factor verification: OTP, QR, and (future) NFC
Delegated access with temporary codes for trusted contacts
Comprehensive delivery history with verification logs

roadmap: Stage 1 (Current PoC): Build core flows â€” QR-based order tagging, OTP verification, customer approval via B2C app, and SDK prototype for brands.
Stage 2: Extend B2B SDK with robust APIs for integration and real-time delivery authorization checks.
Stage 3: Enhance B2C app with delivery history, delegated access (family/friends), and improved UI for real-time approvals.
Stage 4: Introduce NFC-based virtual card verification to support touch-based double authorization.
Stage 5: Add anomaly detection using AI/ML to flag unusual delivery patterns (e.g., location/time mismatches).
Stage 6: Implement blockchain-backed audit logs to ensure tamper-proof delivery history.
Stage 7 (Future): Release native mobile apps for customers and delivery agents with full SecureDrop flows.

key_learnings: Building SDKs for B2B integrations with third-party platforms
Architecting microservices for QR and OTP verification
Balancing usability with strong security protocols
Mapping real-world logistics challenges into digital workflows

story.origin: SecureDrop originated as an idea to combat package theft and delivery fraud by shifting control to the end-customer.
story.journey: The project began with system design diagrams and workflow modeling, evolving into a multi-component PoC with QR and OTP-based double verification.
story.growth: Iterations have focused on integrating brand-side SDKs and customer-facing apps to demonstrate seamless collaboration between logistics providers and end-users.
story.current: SecureDrop is in its Proof-of-Concept stage, demonstrating double verification flows while laying the foundation for NFC, AI-driven anomaly detection, and blockchain-backed audit trails in the future.
